issue.title: Atlas model: Issue with the torque limits

content.raw:
The limits included in the simulation model are taken directly from the [data provided to us by BDI](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/4ca65dd743257ab04a887f6a41b3d28049681be3/atlas_description/raw/drc_skeleton_v3_mod1.cfg?at=default).  For example, the maximum knee pitch torque is given as [220Nm](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/4ca65dd743257ab04a887f6a41b3d28049681be3/atlas_description/raw/drc_skeleton_v3_mod1.cfg?at=default#cl-701) and the maximum ankle pitch torque is given as [700Nm](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/4ca65dd743257ab04a887f6a41b3d28049681be3/atlas_description/raw/drc_skeleton_v3_mod1.cfg?at=default#cl-576).

I agree that those values seem improbable, but we don't have any newer or more accurate information about the torque limits.  We'd happily accept patches to improve the model.
content.html:
The limits included in the simulation model are taken directly from the data provided to us by BDI. For example, the maximum knee pitch torque is given as 220Nm and the maximum ankle pitch torque is given as 700Nm.

I agree that those values seem improbable, but we don't have any newer or more accurate information about the torque limits. We'd happily accept patches to improve the model.
